titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Christian Barthelmess Photograph Album and Photographs of Montana, New Mexico, and Colorado
Barthelmess (Christian) Photograph Album and Photographs of Montana, New Mexico, and Colorado
titlestmt.author: by Matthew D. Mason

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 07:23

did.unittitle: Photograph album and photographs of Montana, New Mexico, and Colorado.

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Photographs created by Christian Barthelmess of people and places in New Mexico, Colorado, and Montana, 1881-1903.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Title devised by cataloger.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Some images in the album have duplicate photographic prints in the collection.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Andrew Smith Gallery on the Arthur Corbitt Hoskins Memorial Fund, 2006.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Christian Barthelmess, Photograph Album and Photographs of Montana, New Mexico, and Colorado collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Christian Barthelmess, Photograph Album and Photographs of Montana, New Mexico, and Colorado. Yale Collection of Western Americana, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Originally from Bavaria, Christian Barthelmess served in the United States Army during the Indian Wars and the Spanish American War as a musician and photographer, 1876-1903.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Seventy-six photographs, consisting of fifty photographic prints in an album and twenty-six loose photographic prints, created by Christian Barthelmess of people and places in New Mexico, Colorado, and Montana, 1881-1903.

did.unittitle: Photographic Prints
did.physdesc: Unmounted photographic prints except where noted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Loose photographic prints of locations in Montana and New Mexico.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Descriptions of the photographic prints are provided by the archivist.

did.unittitle: Fort Keogh, Montana
View looking northwest of officers quarters on Southern Avenue, Fort Keogh, Montana
Exterior portraits
Private in the Twenty-Second infantry, Company C, in a wheelchair and three hospital corpsmen

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Includes a hospital steward with a moustache on the left of the man in the wheelchair and a clean-shaven acting hospital steward on the extreme right, the other standing man is a private

did.unittitle: Private in the Twenty-Second infantry, Company C, in a wheelchair and six hospital corpsmen

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Includes the hospital steward with a moustache on the left of the man in the wheelchair and a clean-shaven acting hospital steward on the extreme right, the other four men are privates

did.unittitle: Two officers, nine women, three girls, and two dogs on an ice rink established in front of the quarters of the commander

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Several women and children wear ice skates

did.unittitle: Four officers, five civilian men, three women, and a dog posed standing and sitting in front of an ivy covered building

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Probably officers from the the Twenty-Second Infantry and Tenth Cavalry. Man seated and looking to the right is identified as Chaplin Isaac Newton Ritner

did.unittitle: Group of officers, civilian men, and women, in front of the quarters of the commander
Two men and two women in a fenced yard, probably a yard of a married enlisted mens quarters located east of the garrison surrounding the parade field called "Soapsuds Row"

odd.head: General note
odd.p: A woman also holds a cat

did.unittitle: Fort Keogh, Montana (Vicinity)
Rocky landscape near a river, probably the badlands of eastern Montana along the Yellowstone River
Rocky landscape, probably the badlands of eastern Montana
Column of troops led by members of the Second Infantry Band with their instruments in cases, and a corporal with a bicycle on the right of the image, near the Tongue River
A first lieutenant in the Fourth Regiment of the United States Cavalry demonstrating horse training techniques
Seven men, three women, and two children, which includes a Native American man and woman, posed standing in front of a building, possibly at an Indian Agency
Group portrait of primarily Native Americans, consisting seven children, ten women, and fourteen men, including one white man

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Incorrect inscription on verso

did.unittitle: Four women posed sitting in a buck wagon pulled by two horses on a snow-covered landscape
Five women posed sitting in a buck wagon pulled by a single horse
Studio portrait of a young Cheyenne Indian woman
Lame Deer Agency, Montana
Group of Native American and white men under porch of a log building

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Identified as General Nelson A. Miles in council with Cheyenne Chiefs. Miles is posed sitting at a table, Two Moons is posed sitting and wearing a white shirt and Army Lieutenant Edward W. Casey immediately behind him

did.unittitle: Little Bighorn River, Montana
Stone obelisk monument to officers and soldiers killed in the Battle of Little Big Horn
Fort Wingate, New Mexico
Thirty-eight soldiers and two dogs in a courtyard with snow on the ground among brick buildings, probably barracks
Fort Wingate, New Mexico (Vicinity)
Cavalry soldier mounted on horseback

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Identified as possibly Capitan Allen Smith, although his uniform shows first sergeant chevrons

did.unittitle: Four Navajo Indian men and a white soldier

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Identified as possibly Capitan Allen Smith, although his uniform shows first sergeant chevrons, with Navajo scouts

did.unittitle: Nine soldiers and a herd of horses at a spring
Album
did.physdesc: 50 photographic prints mounted in an album

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Described in the original order of the album

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Images include locations in Colorado, Montana, New Mexico, and Arizona. Many of the photographs include manuscript inscriptions in German deutscher Schrift. A few images have duplicates in the album.
